messages.common.ui.chrome.bigUrlWarningNotificati: The URL is big and BLUE CATS might stop working
messages.common.ui.errorAllowExplicitIndex.errorD: It looks like your Elasticsearch cluster has the {allowExplicitIndexConfig} setting set to {allowExplicitIndexValue}, which prevents BLUE CATS from making search requests. We use this ability to send a single request to Elasticsearch that searches multiple indexes so that when there are many panels on a dashboard they will load quickly and uniformly.
Unfortunately, until this issue is fixed you won't be able to use certain apps in BLUE CATS, like Discover, Visualize and Dashboard.
messages.common.ui.errorAutoCreateIndex.errorDesc: It looks like your Elasticsearch cluster's {autoCreateIndexActionConfig} setting is preventing BLUE CATS from automatically creating an index to store saved objects. BLUE CATS uses this Elasticsearch feature because it is the best way to make sure that the saved object index uses the correct mappings/schema, and it allows BLUE CATS to poll Elasticsearch less often.
messages.common.ui.errorAutoCreateIndex.errorDisc: Unfortunately, until this issue is fixed you won't be able to save anything in BLUE CATS.
messages.common.ui.errorAutoCreateIndex.noteMessa: The {autoCreateIndexActionConfig} can also define a whitelist of patterns where this feature should be enabled. We don't discuss how to use the setting that way here because it requires knowing all of the other plugins/interactions that rely on the feature for the same reasons that BLUE CATS does.
messages.common.ui.errorUrlOverflow.errorDescript: That's a big URL you have there. I have some unfortunate news: Your browser doesn't play nice with BLUE CATS's bacon-double-cheese-burger-with-extra-fries sized URL. To keep you from running into problems BLUE CATS limits URLs in your browser to {urlCharacterLimit} characters for your safety.
messages.common.ui.fieldEditor.disabledCallOutLab: All inline scripting has been disabled in Elasticsearch. You must enable inline scripting for at least one language in order to use scripted fields in BLUE CATS.
messages.common.ui.fieldEditor.syntax.defaultLabe: By default, BLUE CATS scripted fields use {painless}, a simple and secure scripting language designed specifically for use with Elasticsearch, to access values in the document use the following format:
messages.common.ui.fieldEditor.syntax.kibanaLabel: BLUE CATS currently imposes one special limitation on the painless scripts you write. They cannot contain named functions.
messages.common.ui.fieldEditor.syntax.lucene.comm: Coming from an older version of BLUE CATS? The {lucene} you know and love are still available. Lucene expressions are a lot like JavaScript, but limited to basic arithmetic, bitwise and comparison operations.
messages.common.ui.fieldEditor.warningCallOut.des: Scripted fields can be used to display and aggregate calculated values. As such, they can be very slow, and if done incorrectly, can cause BLUE CATS to be unusable. There's no safety net here. If you make a typo, unexpected exceptions will be thrown all over the place!
messages.common.ui.fieldEditor.warningLabel.warni: {language} is deprecated and support will be removed in the next major version of BLUE CATS and Elasticsearch. We recommend using {painlessLink} for new scripted fields.
messages.common.ui.legacyBrowserMessage: この Kibana インストレーションは、現在ご使用のブラウザが満たしていない厳格なセキュリティ要件が有効になっています。
messages.common.ui.notify.fatalError.unavailableS: An HTTP request has failed to connect. Please check if the BLUE CATS server is running and that your browser has a working connection, or contact your system administrator.
messages.common.ui.notify.toaster.unavailableServ: An HTTP request has failed to connect. Please check if the BLUE CATS server is running and that your browser has a working connection, or contact your system administrator.
messages.common.ui.savedObjects.howToSaveAsNewDes: In previous versions of BLUE CATS, changing the name of a {savedObjectName} would make a copy with the new name. Use the 'Save as a new {savedObjectName}' checkbox to do this now.
messages.common.ui.stateManagement.unableToStoreH:
BLUE CATS is unable to store history items in your session because it is full and there don't seem to be items any items safe to delete.

 This can usually be fixed by moving to a fresh tab, but could be caused by a larger issue. If you are seeing this message regularly, please file an issue at {gitHubIssuesUrl}.
messages.common.ui.vis.kibanaMap.zoomWarning: You've reached the maximum number of zoom levels. To zoom all the way in, upgrade to the {defaultDistribution} of Elasticsearch and BLUE CATS. You'll get access to additional zoom levels for free through the {ems}. Or, you can configure your own map server. Please go to { wms } or { configSettings} for more information.
messages.common.ui.welcomeErrorMessage: Kibana が正常に読み込まれませんでした。詳細はサーバーアウトプットを確認してください。
messages.data.query.queryBar.luceneSyntaxWarningM: Lucene クエリ構文を使用しているようですが、Kibana クエリ言語 (KQL) が選択されています。KQL ドキュメント {link} を確認してください。
messages.data.query.queryBar.syntaxOptionsDescrip: {docsLink} (KQL) は、シンプルなクエリ構文とスクリプトフィールドのサポートを提供します。また、KQL はベーシックライセンス以上をご利用の場合、自動入力も提供します。KQL をオフにすると、Kibana は Lucene を使用します。
messages.core.chrome.legacyBrowserWarning: ご使用のブラウザが Kibana のセキュリティ要件を満たしていません。
messages.inputControl.editor.optionsTab.updateFil: Update BLUE CATS filters on each change

messages.kbn.advancedSettings.courier.maxRequests: Controls the {maxRequestsLink} setting used for _msearch requests sent by BLUE CATS. Set to 0 to disable this config and use the Elasticsearch default.
messages.kbn.advancedSettings.darkModeText: Kibana UI のダークモードを有効にします。この設定を適用するにはページの更新が必要です。
messages.kbn.advancedSettings.disableAnimationsTe: Turn off all unnecessary animations in the BLUE CATS UI. Refresh the page to apply the changes.
messages.kbn.advancedSettings.searchQueryLanguage: Query language used by the query bar. KQL is a new language built specifically for BLUE CATS.
messages.kbn.advancedSettings.timepicker.timeDefa: The timefilter selection to use when BLUE CATS is started without one

messages.kbn.dashboard.listing.createNewDashboard: You can combine data views from any BLUE CATS app into one dashboard and see everything in one place.
New to BLUE CATS? {sampleDataInstallLink} to take a test drive.
messages.kbn.home.addData.sampleDataLink: Load a data set and a BLUE CATS dashboard
messages.kbn.home.directories.notFound.viewFullBu: View full directory of BLUE CATS plugins
messages.kbn.home.tutorial.card.sampleDataDescrip: Get started exploring BLUE CATS with these `one click` data sets.
messages.kbn.management.createIndexPattern.stepTi: BLUE CATS will provide a unique identifier for each index pattern. If you do not want to use this unique ID, enter a custom one.
messages.kbn.management.createIndexPatternLabel: BLUE CATS uses index patterns to retrieve data from Elasticsearch indices for things like visualizations.
messages.kbn.management.editIndexPattern.mappingC: {conflictFieldsLength, plural, one {A field is} other {# fields are}} defined as several types (string, integer, etc) across the indices that match this pattern. You may still be able to use these conflict fields in parts of BLUE CATS, but they will be unavailable for functions that require BLUE CATS to know their type. Correcting this issue will require reindexing your data.
messages.kbn.management.editIndexPattern.scripted: The following deprecated languages are in use: {deprecatedLangsInUse}. Support for these languages will be removed in the next major version of BLUE CATS and Elasticsearch. Convert you scripted fields to {link} to avoid any problems.
messages.kbn.management.indexPatternPrompt.subtit: インデックスパターンは、Kibana で共有フィールドにクエリを実行できるよう、種類の異なるデータソースをバケットにまとめることができます。
messages.kbn.management.landing.subhead: インデックス、インデックスパターン、保存されたオブジェクト、Kibana の設定、その他を管理します。
messages.kbn.management.settings.advancedSettings: Directly edit settings that control behavior in BLUE CATS.
messages.kbn.management.settings.callOutCautionDe: Be careful in here, these settings are for very advanced users only. Tweaks you make here can break large portions of BLUE CATS. Some of these settings may be undocumented, unsupported or experimental. If a field has a default value, blanking the field will reset it to its default which may be unacceptable given other configuration directives. Deleting a custom setting will permanently remove it from BLUE CATS's config.
messages.kbn.management.settings.field.helpText: This setting is overridden by the BLUE CATS server and can not be changed.
messages.kbn.server.tutorials.kibanaMetrics.longD: The `BLUE CATS` Metricbeat module fetches internal metrics from BLUE CATS. [Learn more]({learnMoreLink}).
messages.kbn.server.tutorials.kibanaMetrics.short: Fetch internal metrics from BLUE CATS.
messages.kbn.server.tutorials.netflow.common.setu: The {setupOption} option creates a {netflowPrefix} index pattern in Elasticsearch and imports BLUE CATS dashboards and visualizations. Omit this option for subsequent runs to avoid overwriting existing dashboards.

The {setupOption} option creates a {netflowPrefix} index pattern in Elasticsearch and imports BLUE CATS dashboards and visualizations. Omit this option for subsequent runs to avoid overwriting existing dashboards.
messages.kbn.server.tutorials.netflow.tutorialLon: The Logstash Netflow module collects and parses network flow data, indexes the events into Elasticsearch, and installs a suite of BLUE CATS dashboards. This module support Netflow Version 5 and 9. [Learn more]({linkUrl}).
messages.regionMap.choroplethLayer.downloadingVec: Cannot download {name} file. Please ensure the CORS configuration of the server permits requests from the BLUE CATS application on this host.
messages.timelion.help.configuration.valid.timeRa: Use the timepicker in the BLUE CATS toolbar to select the time period that contains the data you want to visualize. Make sure you select a time period that includes all or part of the time range shown above.
messages.timelion.help.dataTransforming.paragraph: to see how to use all of the available Timelion functions. You can view the reference at any time by clicking {Docs} in the BLUE CATS toolbar. To get back to this tutorial, click the {Tutorial} link at the top of the reference.
messages.timelion.help.expressions.paragraph3: We`re going to experiment, so click {strongAdd} in the BLUE CATS toolbar to add another chart or three. Then, select a chart, copy one of the following expressions, paste it into the input bar, and hit enter. Rinse, repeat to try out the other expressions.
messages.timelion.help.functions.es.args.kibanaHe: Respect filters on BLUE CATS dashboards. Only has an effect when using on BLUE CATS dashboards
messages.timelion.help.functions.graphiteHelpText: [experimental] Pull data from graphite. Configure your graphite server in BLUE CATS's Advanced Settings
messages.timelion.help.functions.quandlHelpText: [experimental] Pull data from quandl.com using the quandl code. Set {quandlKeyField} to your free API key in BLUE CATS's Advanced Settings. The API has a really low rate limit without a key.
messages.timelion.topNavMenu.save.saveAsDashboard: Need to add a chart to a BLUE CATS dashboard? We can do that! This option will save your currently selected expression as a panel that can be added to BLUE CATS dashboards as you would add anything else. Note, if you use references to other panels you will need to remove the refences by copying the referenced expression directly into the expression you are saving. Click a chart to select a different expression to save.
Save current expression as BLUE CATS dashboard panel
messages.timelion.topNavMenu.save.saveEntireSheet: You want this option if you mostly use Timelion expressions from within the Timelion app and don't need to add Timelion charts to BLUE CATS dashboards. You may also want this if you make use of references to other panels.
messages.xpack.apm.servicesTable.UpgradeAssistant: Kibana アップグレードアシスタントで詳細をご覧ください
messages.xpack.beatsManagement.beatsTable.configS: This Beat has not connected to BLUE CATS in over 10min
messages.xpack.beatsManagement.disabledSecurityDe: You must enable security in BLUE CATS and Elasticsearch to use Beats central management.

messages.xpack.graph.settings.drillDowns.kibanaUr: This looks like a BLUE CATS URL. Would you like us to convert it to a template for you?

messages.xpack.telemetry.callout.errorLoadingClus: クラスター統計の取得中に予期せぬエラーが発生しました。Elasticsearch、Kibana、またはネットワークのエラーが原因の可能性があります。Kibana を確認し、ページを再読み込みして再試行してください。
messages.xpack.telemetry.telemetryErrorNotificati: Kibana と Elasticsearch が現在も実行中であることを確認し、再試行してください。
messages.xpack.maps.mapListing.betaMessageBadge: マップはまだベータ段階です。Kibana repo で問題やバグを報告して、製品の改善にご協力ください。

messages.xpack.ml.jobsList.editJobFlyout.customUr: An error occurred loading the list of saved BLUE CATS dashboards
messages.xpack.ml.tooltips.newCustomUrlLinkToTool: Link to a BLUE CATS dashboard, Discover or another URL.
messages.xpack.monitoring.elasticsearch.indices.h: システムインデックス (例: Kibana) をご希望の場合は、「システムインデックスを表示」にチェックを入れてみてください。

Delay in BLUE CATS server event loops. Longer delays may indicate blocking events in server thread, such as synchronous functions taking large amount of CPU time.
Total heap used by BLUE CATS running in Node.js.
messages.xpack.monitoring.noData.explanations.exp: Check that the intended exporters are enabled for sending statistics to the monitoring cluster, and that the monitoring cluster host matches the {monitoringEs} setting in {kibanaConfig} to see monitoring data in this instance of BLUE CATS.

Using monitoring exporters ship the monitoring data to a remote monitoring cluster is highly recommended as it keeps the integrity of the monitoring data safe no matter what the state of the production cluster. However, as this instance of BLUE CATS could not find any monitoring data, there seems to be a problem with the {property} configuration, or the {monitoringEs} settings in {kibanaConfig}.
messages.xpack.reporting.exportTypes.printablePdf: Unable to generate report for url {savedObjUrl}, it's not a BLUE CATS URL

messages.xpack.upgradeAssistant.tabs.upgradingInt: すべての Elasticsearch ノードがアップグレードされました。Kibana をアップデートする準備ができました。

messages.common.ui.indexPattern.bannerLabel: In order to visualize and explore data in BLUE CATS, you need to create an index pattern to retrieve data from Elasticsearch.
messages.kbn.management.editIndexPattern.unsuppor: Support for time-interval based index patterns has been removed! In the next major version of BLUE CATS this index patterns will stop working. Migrate saved objects that use this index pattern to a wildcard pattern and delete this one.

messages.xpack.main.telemetry.callout.errorLoadin: An unexpected error occured while attempting to fetch the cluster statistics. This can occur because Elasticsearch failed, BLUE CATS failed, or there is a network error. Check BLUE CATS, then reload the page and try again.
messages.xpack.main.telemetry.telemetryErrorNotif: Check that BLUE CATS and Elasticsearch are still running, then try again.
messages.xpack.security.management.editRoles.priv: This role never grants access to any spaces within BLUE CATS. To customize privileges for individual spaces, you must create a new role.
messages.xpack.security.management.editRoles.simp: Specifies the BLUE CATS privilege for this role.
